meanings.definition: A substance used to expel or drive out something, such as gas or waste.
meanings.sent1: The expellants in the cleaner help remove tough stains.
meanings.sent2: The expellants in the medication help relieve congestion.
meanings.sent3: The expellants in the air freshener make the room smell like flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like expellants, pushing away all the sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The expellants in the engine keep it running smoothly.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that expels or forces something out.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was seen as an expellants of knowledge to her students.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum cleaner is an expellants of dust and dirt from the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow acted as an expellants, keeping birds away from the crops.
meanings.sent4: His words were like expellants, driving away any doubts in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The whistle served as an expellants, signaling the start of the race.

meanings.definition: The act of expelling or forcing something out.
meanings.sent1: The expellants of air from the balloon made it fly across the room.
meanings.sent2: The expellants of water from the hose helped clean the car.
meanings.sent3: The expellants of confetti at the party surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The expellants of emotions during the argument left them both feeling drained.
meanings.sent5: The expellants of students from the classroom signaled the end of the school day.
